entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:41PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Late Tonight Through Monday Night... Snow is expected above 3000 feet from late tonight through Monday night. Several inches is possible above 3000 feet, with up to 4 inches above 4000 feet. Snow will taper off Monday night.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:39PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 4000 Feet through Monday... Snow is expected above 4000 feet from late tonight through Monday night. Up to 3 inches above 4000 feet. Snow will taper off Monday night.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 4:39PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water on the Tanana River and Tributaries Draining the Alaska Range Continues This Week... High water on the Tanana River and tributaries draining the Alaska Range will continue this week. This includes the Chisana River, Nabesna River, Gerstle River, Delta River, and the Nenana River. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 1:16PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WATER EXPECTED TO CONTINUE IN THE SUSITNA BASIN... High water levels can be expected to continue on the Susitna River and its tributaries through the next couple of days. This includes the Talkeetna, Yentna, Skwentna, Kashwitna and Little Susitna Rivers and associated streams such as Willow, Montana and Moose Creeks.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 4:14AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED WILDFIRE POTENTIAL FOR WESTERN UPPER MICHIGAN DUE TO A COMBINATION OF GUSTY SOUTH WINDS, DRY AND HOT CONDITIONS... Gusty south winds as high as 25 mph, combined with dry and hot conditions and a lack of recent rainfall will lead to elevated wildfire potential this afternoon across far western Upper Michigan.
